programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned in in Guildford, Torquay and Barry, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Live Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley present appeals for help with unsolved cases. Reporter John-Paul Davies is out and about with stories from across the UK.(n)

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A tenant making over a £100,000 unlawfully sub-letting his council flat in London. Plus, efforts to rescue over 150 dogs being kept in squalid conditions at an animal centre in Lincolnshire.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anglesey 9 Anita Manning is joined by Nick Hall and Danny Sebastian at Mona Showground on Anglesey, and finds out how the village of Portmeirion became the birthplace of some famous pottery.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Fifty-Fifty Daniel has a final chance to persuade Maisie to end the hunger strike, as Jimmi finds out some disturbing news about the university. Luca tries to help two sisters who are at odds over how to care for their father as he struggles with worsening dementia.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Somerset Jules Hudson is on a property-hunting mission spanning Somerset and Devon's Exmoor National Park with a couple who have a £550,000 budget and a love of carpentry and the coast. Along the way, he visits the Wool Marketing Board's fleece-sorting depot in South Molton, which grades and sells sheep wool from across the south-west region, and which contributes to Britain's £35million wool industry each year.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Glasgow friends Simon and Carolyn are the chief cooks in both their households. They know each other's strengths and weaknesses well and are keen to see whether that will help or hinder them in Rylan Clark-Neal's fast-and-furious kitchen contest. They are joined in the Green Kitchen by queen of spice Romy Gill, while Anna Haugh brings a modern British and Irish twist to the Red Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the hospital board meet to make their decision about Ash's future, Suki has one more trick up her sleeve. Sharon's leaving party is unexpectedly quiet, but it proves the perfect opportunity for Kim to sign people up to her dating services. Mitch realises his efforts were in vain as he tries to do the right thing.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Salmond v Sturgeon The inside story of the most sensational break-up in recent political history. Once close friends and allies, Alex Salmond and Nicola Sturgeon took the SNP from nowhere to government, and Scotland to the brink of independence. Now sworn enemies, former First Minister Salmond accuses some of those he once led of plotting to have him imprisoned. Reporter Mark Daly investigates and asks what the split could mean for the future of Scotland, and for the United Kingdom.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third quarter-final sees four talented heat-winners return to vie for a place in knockout week by participating in the Critic's Test. The challenge - set by infamously hard task-master Jay Rayner - is to prepare a dessert where stone fruit is the star. Gregg Wallace and John Torode preside as the contenders endeavour to take another step closer to being crowned MasterChef Champion 2021.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 Fiona Bruce introduces a topical debate with a virtual audience from around the UK. On his panel this week are the Safeguarding Minister Victoria Atkins MP, Shadow Minister for Domestic Violence and Safeguarding Jess Phillips MP, Deputy Leader of the SNP at Westminster Kirsten Oswald MP, economist and former Governor of the Bank of Canada and of the Bank of England Mark Carney and journalist and broadcaster Ian Hislop.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: The Truth About Antibiotics Angela Rippon investigates new methods scientists are searching for to fight bacterial infection, revealing how a growing number of bacterial diseases are becoming resistant to the antibiotics currently in use. She meets a GP on the frontline in the fight against infection, and finds out how people can take part in the effort to keep the 'miracle cure' effective.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 19/03/2021 Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: 19/03/2021 Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit properties in Birkenhead, Paisley and Madeley Heath, Staffordshire, talking to their new owners about their plans.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Live Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley present appeals for help with unsolved cases. Reporter John-Paul Davies is out and about with stories from across the UK.(n)

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: In Birmingham, the investigators crack down on the callous travel agent ripping off British holidaymakers, taking their money but never booking their flights. In light of the story of one limo driving a school party of 11-year-olds bursting into flames, there's also some spot-checking on luxury limos being driven in London.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Shrewsbury 14 Experts Thomas Forrester and Kate Bliss offer advice as contestants head out into the pouring rain in Shrewsbury to secure items of potential profit under the gavel, where auctioneer Philip Serrell awaits. Love is in the air for presenter Christina Trevanion as she explains how to flirt using a fan.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges artists to make something amazing for the homes of people they've never met. Today's buyers live in Whitstable and have £750 to spend on a seaside-themed masterpiece.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Yorkshire Dales Margherita Taylor goes rural property-shopping in the Yorkshire Dales with a retired head teacher who has £400,000 to invest in her leap to the country and has signed up her daughter to help her with the decision making. Away from a high-energy house hunt, Margherita discovers how one Dales company has recently been instrumental in reviving Britain's hand-made piano heritage, an echo of production glory days during the 1920s.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Married couple Marcus and Paul are paired with chefs Ellis Barrie and Anna Haugh in the fast-and-furious cookery contest. Paul does most of the cooking in their home and he's keen for Marcus to get more involved. The winner will be decided in a hectic 10-Minute Challenge where the chefs must cook against the clock to produce show stopping dishes under pressure. Rylan Clark-Neal hosts.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Leather expert Suzie Fletcher undertakes the repair of a treasured toy horse, while metal expert Dominic Chinea's knowledge is called upon to rejuvenate a vintage lawnmower. Also receiving attention is a delicately carved set of clay sculptures.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2021
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Davina McCall, Paddy McGuinness, Alesha Dixon and David Tennant preside as stars of stage, screen and the movies entertain the nation with hilarious sketches, live performances, big surprises and stunning music acts in a bid to raise much-needed cash for good causes at home and across the world. Highlights include Michael Sheen, Anna Friel and Keira Knightley in the greatest disaster movie never made, the hosts of Top Gear facing interrogation by their most savage critics to date and Dawn French back as Geraldine Granger, joined by the Rev Kate Bottley. Fans of Fleabag and Normal People get a confessional close-up as the stars of two of TV's biggest shows meet for a mash up like no other, Alex Scott and Jermaine Jenas take part in the world's largest and longest Red Nose and Spoon Race and Tim Vine rewards the men and women of the UK's military forces by spreading a smile. Five comedians have just 24 hours to perfect their opera voices under the watchful eye of their mento.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2021
programme.desc: The Great Comic Relief Prizeathon Jason Manford and Amanda Holden continue the Comic Relief extravaganza with special guests, comedy, and the chance for viewers to win a number of once-in-a-lifetime prizes. With music by Rag'n'Bone Man, and Joel Corry and RAYE.(n)

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Bank Balance
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's Bank Balance for Red Nose Day Gino D'Acampo and his son Luci compete in this special edition of the game show, stacking the gold bars on the balance board in a bid to win up to £100,000 for charity. But if they have answered incorrectly, the bars they stack will amount to nothing - and only serve to add further weight to the already precarious board, which could collapse at any second and leave them with nothing.(n)

programme.title: Billy Monger's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: In April 2017 the professional racing driver was seriously injured in a collision that resulted in both of his legs being amputated. Already used to pushing the limits of what can be achieved, Billy now pushes himself to the limit as he takes on a truly unforgettable challenge - walking, kayaking and cycling 140 miles in the name of charity. His trek begins at the Millennium Bridge in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, ultimately heading to Brands Hatch in Kent. Before he starts, the 21-year-old receives words of encouragement from Jose Mourinho, manager of his beloved Tottenham Hotspur, and along the route is joined by a host of celebrity supporters including Cheryl, Zoe Ball, Chris Ramsey, Dan Walker and Vick Hope.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 20/03/2021 Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: 20/03/2021 Matt Tebbutt is joined by guests Sabrina Ghayour, Tom Booton and Richard Curtis. Olly Smith joins by video link, and selects wines to accompany the meals prepared in the studio.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Ready Steady Cook for Red Nose Day Rylan Clark-Neal hosts this celebrity edition of the kitchen duel, which sees actor Stephen Mangan squaring up against barrister and TV judge Robert Rinder in a battle of the pots and pans. Paired with chefs Jeremy Pang and Ellis Barrie, they must create dishes from their £5.00 bag of ingredients in just 20 minutes - and with everything from a spicy noodle soup to a massive mushroom vol-au-vent on offer, it promises to be a close call.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: 20/03/2021 Dan Walker is joined by Karen Carney and Dion Dublin to look ahead to the sixth round of the FA Cup.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kedleston 27 Natasha Raskin Sharp challenges two teams to search for bargains at an antiques fair in the grounds of Kedleston Hall, Derbyshire. John Cameron and Tim Weeks offer expert advice.(n)

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Italy Scotland v Italy . All the action from the match in the fifth round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Scotland have won the last nine meetings between the sides and will expect to extend that run today given their superior form in this year's championship. With analysis from John Barclay and Jeremy Guscott and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Brian Moore and Andy Nicol.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: 20/03/2021 Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites Amanda Abbington, Rick Edwards, Richard Blackwood and Laura Tobin to take to the black chair. In the first round, they are put to the test on their chosen specialist subjects - Phoebe from Friends, An American Werewolf in London, Bon Jovi, and the octopus. The second round sees them tackling general knowledge questions in a bid to carry off the commemorative trophy.(n)

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts a new family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Danny Dyer hosts the game show, which sees an engaged couple of teachers from Essex answer questions that combine knowledge, strategy and luck. They hope to put the prize money towards a new home for themselves and their baby daughter.(n)

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: France v Wales France v Wales . All the action from the match in the fifth round of fixtures, held at Stade de France. Les Bleus clinched a 27-23 victory when the sides met at Principality Stadium last year, but Wales prevailed 24-19 on their last visit here in 2019, and should head into this match in a confident mood after easily beating rivals England 40-24 in the third round of fixtures. With analysis from Sam Warburton, Martin Johnson and Thomas Castaignede, and commentary by Eddie Butler, Jonathan Davies and Benjamin Kayser.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: 20/03/2021 Brighton & Hove Albion v Newcastle United. Gary Lineker presents highlights of the Premier League match at Amex Stadium. Both teams were in need of points to boost their chances of avoiding relegation, and it was Brighton who were comfortable 3-0 victors when the sides met at St James' Park in September. Plus, a look back at Friday's clash between Fulham and Leeds United at Craven Cottage.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: 20/03/2021 Dan Walker presents action from today's sixth-round ties - Bournemouth v Southampton at Vitality Stadium and Everton v Manchester City at Goodison Park. Bournemouth were the only Championship side remaining in the competition but will have been hoping to make home advantage count against their South Coast rivals, while the Citizens were looking to emulate their 3-1 away win over Everton in the league last month.(n)

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Limboland
programme.desc: The comedian muses on people's expectations of happiness in a performance recorded at the Hammersmith Apollo. He shares the story of a disastrous family trip to see the Northern Lights, recalls a meeting with Paul McCartney that did not go as expected and performs a heart-rending country and western ballad on the nature of love.(n)

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Danny Dyer hosts the game show, which sees an engaged couple of teachers from Essex answer questions that combine knowledge, strategy and luck. They hope to put the prize money towards a new home for themselves and their baby daughter.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: 21/03/2021 A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.desc: 21/03/2021 The latest political news and debate from the region.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2021
programme.desc: Comic Relief 2021: The Best Bits Stars of stage, screen and the movies gather to entertain the nation with hilarious sketches, live performances, big surprises and stunning music acts in a celebration to raise much-needed cash for good causes at home and across the world. Hosted by Lenny Henry, Davina McCall, Paddy McGuinness, Alesha Dixon and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Chelsea v Sheffield United Chelsea v Sheffield United . Gabby Logan presents coverage of the sixth-round tie at Stamford Bridge. The Blues are looking to reach the semi-finals for the fourth time in five seasons and enter this match as strong favourites given the struggles of the Blades in this season's Premier League. The sides have also met twice in the league this season, with Chelsea prevailing 4-1 here in November and 2-1 at Bramall Lane last month. With analysis from Micah Richards.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Stamford Charlie Dimmock and the Rich Brothers compete to design a garden for a family of seven in Stamford, Lincolnshire, who want a peaceful garden that they can call their own.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Leicester City v Manchester United.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: First Signs of Spring Ellie Harrison celebrates the arrival of Spring on her home turf in the Cotswolds. From the millions of snowdrops in Painswick's Rococo Gardens to discovering some old folklore, finding out about a scheme to enable wheelchair users to enjoy tougher terrain in the great outdoors and meeting the cattle that encourage wildflowers, Ellie also raids the Countryfile Archive, revisiting the time she went on dolphin watch in Cardigan Bay, Matt Baker visited tulip fields in Lincolnshire, and Adam Henson went to North Yorkshire to catch his supper.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes some of greatest-ever cars featured in James Bond movies for a spin, including the iconic Aston Martin DB5. Freddie Flintoff gets behind the wheel of an Extreme E race car and puts it to the test against a man in a jet-pack, while Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness test a new Ferrari against a very old Alfa.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Jed Mercurio's smash-hit crime thriller returns for its sixth instalment, with Martin Compston, Vicky McClure and Adrian Dunbar reprising their roles as DS Steve Arnott, DI Kate Fleming and Superintendent Ted Hastings. New information comes to light about a possible suspect in a year-long unsolved murder, and DCI Joanne Davidson appears keen to finally bring Gail Vella's killer to justice. However, her conduct soon arouses suspicion, and it's not long before AC-12 are on the case. But as their investigation uncovers deeper and darker information, will Davidson turn out to be their most dangerous adversary yet?(n)

programme.desc: 21/03/2021 Action from the concluding sixth-round ties - Chelsea v Sheffield United at Bramall Lane and Leicester City v Manchester United at King Power Stadium.(n)

programme.desc: Chefs Ellis Barrie and Jeremy Pang prepare meals against the clock, using ingredients brought in by two friends who teach young people life skills. Rylan Clark-Neal hosts.(n)

programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team set to work restoring a precious Indian stringed instrument, a Second World War pilot's jacket and a broken toy bird that has lost its tweet.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Panorama: Covid: Who Got it Right? A year on from the first UK lockdown, Jane Corbin investigates Covid-19 policies pursued by governments around the world, and sets out to discover which nations have had the most successful approach, how the outcomes can be analysed, and attempts to understand what lessons might be learned for future pandemics.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Mick and Linda are finally back behind the bar at the Vic, and soon receive a visit from DI Pine with the news that Katy has been arrested. But when Stuart listens in, he is desperate to get revenge for his old friend. Stacey gets bad news from her solicitor, prompting Jean into an angry confrontation with Jean and Martin. Kheerat and Suki are unhappy when Vinny gives a statement to the police, and Tiffany accidentally overcharges a customer, giving Dotty a money-making idea.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: The Builders Penny-pinching Basil goes behind Sybil's back to save money on structural alterations to the hotel and hires an incompetent cowboy builder to do the job - an underhand tactic that ends up costing him dearly. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Football's Darkest Secret
programme.desc: The End of Silence Season 1 Episode 1/3.(n)

programme.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The grand finale of the drag queen competition has arrived, with choreographer on hand to coach the finalists an through all-singing all-dancing extravaganza to impress judges Michelle Visage, Alan Carr and Graham Norton. All of this year's eliminated queens will be returning to the studio to enjoy the show and see this year's superstar crowned.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes some of greatest-ever cars featured in James Bond movies for a spin, including the iconic Aston Martin DB5.
