programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties in Bigrigg in Cumbria, Church Gresley in Derbyshire and Hammersmith in west London.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Live Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley present appeals for help with unsolved cases. Reporter John-Paul Davies is out and about with stories from across the UK.(n)

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: A trauma team arrives by helicopter at a high-speed car crash in Forth Valley, while John visits a Hugh Jackman super-fan who needs help with her breathing.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Westpoint 32 Eric Knowles hosts as experts Nick Hall and Richard Madley help two teams scour Exeter's Westpoint Arena for items. The presenter also receives a visit by the chairman of the Torquay Pottery Collectors Society, who has a rather special pasty to show him.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Game On Daniel faces a race against time to get to the bottom of the dodgy dealings going on at the university. Al discovers the true identity of his online chess opponent and Rob is caught between two brothers as a case of extortion explodes into violence.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Welsh Borders Jules Hudson helps a retired couple spend £1million on a character property in the Welsh Borders, trying to find somewhere with holiday let potential or space for a glamping business. Away from the search, Jules also meets experts in traditional construction methods who are keeping heritage building skills alive.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Best friends Sandra and Rachel have recently embarked on a weight loss and healthier lifestyle plan, and are hoping to get some new ideas to bring fantastic flavour to ingredients they know well. Rylan Clark-Neal hosts as they bring some some friendly rivalry to the kitchen, with help from chefs Romy Gill and Anna Haugh.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Paper conservator Louise Drover is asked to rescue a pastel portrait of a young couple damaged by water, while clockwork maestro Steve Fletcher gets to work on a 1950s toy rocket which used to make sparks. Finally, leather expert Suzie Fletcher works on a cherished purse that has seen better days, crumbling and being held together with elastic bands.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Lockdown Live: What Next
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty and Nick Robinson present this live BBC News special, one year on since the UK's first lockdown. Broadcasting from a mass vaccination centre in Newcastle, they'll be joined by a panel of special guests who have stories to tell about how the Covid-19 pandemic has impacted everyone. Naga and Nick reflect on some of the biggest lockdown stories of the year, and look forward to ask how the world is going to change beyond the pandemic.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The news of Katy's arrest becomes common knowledge and Mick fears that everyone knows it is about him. Meanwhile, Frankie meets Stuart at the car lot office. Ruby makes her feelings about the Slaters pretty clear to Kush, while Jean comes up with a plan to save Stacey. Racist graffiti on the Minute Mart brings up painful memories for the Panesars.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Two members of staff find themselves in a tight spot, as Louis is bleeding out after being attacked by an old friend, while Cameron still has Ange held hostage - although the truth of his crimes is coming to light. Can he lie his way out of Holby or will those he has tricked manage to save their colleague end his reign of terror? Meanwhile, Dom returns to work after his operation and his decision to sue the hospital - and despite his attempts to forget the past, a petty patient soon revives his hunger for revenge.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the last of the heats which sees five more hopefuls competing for an apron by cooking their signature dish - something that tells John and Gregg about who they are as a cook and how good they can become. The two best will automatically go through, while the remaining three must cook two courses for John and Gregg as well as Dhruv Baker and Alex Rushmer - champion and finalist from the 2010 competition.(n)

programme.title: Football's Darkest Secret
programme.desc: Missed Opportunities The second part of the documentary explores why it has taken so long for the full scale of child abuse in football to emerge. The documentary follows the investigation into former Southampton youth coach Bob Higgins, filming alongside Hampshire Police detectives as they conduct interviews with Higgins and the survivors.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Suffolk Jules Hudson helps a dog groomer who wants to relocate her business to Suffolk on a budget of £320,000. He also meets the team behind an ambitious project to restore an Anglo-Saxon longship, the remains of which were unearthed by an amateur archaeologist in the 1930s.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Sisters Julie and Debbie are both interested in rustling up healthy meals they can make without spending hours in the kitchen. Chefs Akis Petretzikis and Romy Gill come up with a couple of ideas, while Rylan Clark-Neal makes sure things don't get too boring.(n)

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Masterminds The presenter introduces the unique talents of the world's most intelligent animals, investigating how nature's masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 The latest stories from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Bitesize Daily for Secondary
programme.desc: Creativity Week - Day 4 Artist Ricky Martin on creating your own cartoon, plus more Big Songs.(n)

programme.title: Charles Dickens and the Invention of Christmas
Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: James Braxton v Kate Bliss Foreign Antiques Market Antiques experts James Braxton and Kate Bliss visit an antiques fair in Waterloo, Belgium, where James splashes out on an expensive portrait and Kate buys a rare toy aeroplane.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: James Braxton vs Kate Bliss UK Antiques Fair Antiques experts James Braxton and Kate Bliss continue their rivalry at an antiques fair in Peterborough, buying and selling collectibles for the most profit.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Gloucester 29 The team pays a visit to Gloucester Cathedral, where experts Philip Serrell and Michael Baggott discover some rare gems among the antiques and collectibles brought for valuation, including a pre-Columbian burial vessel - one of the oldest items ever to have been featured on the show. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin marvels at the building's stained glass windows, one of which is as big as a tennis court.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Dane Baptiste, Richard Herring, June Sarpong and Kate Williams test their general knowledge skills on this week's special House of Games: Champion editions.(n)

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Jon & Michelle's Horse Cart Simon Parfett and team head to the Forest of Dean, where they help Jon and Michelle to turn their old horse cart into a cosy and comfortable sanctuary for guests.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Northern Exposure
programme.desc: South Sweden Si King and Dave Myers sample the delicacies of a fisherwoman who had to fight for a place in the fishing community, before cooking meatballs with wild boar. The duo take DNA tests to find out if they have any Viking blood flowing through their veins, before heading for Stockholm where Dave takes a preserving masterclass with city gardener Johan and Si gets a pastry crash course with one of Sweden's youngest and most talented bakers. They conclude their road trip by taking a ferry to the medieval island of Gotland.(n)

programme.title: A Wild Year
programme.desc: The North York Moors: A Wild Year An exploration of the upland area of North Yorkshire, where heather-clad uplands and sheltered dales have been shaped both by the elements and by its people. Hardy Swaledale sheep roam the high moors all year round only coming down to the lowlands for lambing and shearing. Red grouse feed and breed amongst the heather alongside curlews and other ground nesting birds and billions of purple heather blooms provide nectar for the bees, brought to the moors by beekeepers in the summer. Toby Jones narrates, as time-lapse camera techniques bring fresh insight into the restless rhythms of the region.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Science of Sewage
programme.desc: Dr George McGavin, Dr Zoe Laughlin and a team of world-leading scientists explore the biology, chemistry, natural history and social history of faeces from a TV-base camp like no other - within the pools, tanks and bowels of one of the UK's largest and most technologically advanced sewage works.(n)

programme.title: Rob Brydon's Now That's What I Call Comic Relief
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Rob Brydon takes a look at the funniest, sweetest and silliest musical sketches and performances from the Comic Relief store cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Pluto: Back from the Dead New discoveries from the edge of the solar system are transforming what is known about Pluto, thanks to the New Horizons space probe that took the first-ever close up images of the planet. Pluto was once thought to be geologically dead, but the pictures revealed it to be an active world of stunning complexity, with mountains carved from ice, a nitrogen glacier that appeared to be moving and a recently active volcano, with data sent back lead some scientists to speculate that there may even be life on Pluto today.(n)

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. In the first episode, she comes to the aid of Richard, who wants to learn if a man claiming to be his biological father is the genuine article, and Charlie, who wants to know what her chances are of contracting the same terminal illness as her father.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The first quarter-final sees the four talented heat-winners return to fight for a place in knockout week in the Critic's Test. Their brief - set by Grace Dent, one of the country's toughest food critics - is to cook their take on a great British pudding. Presented by Gregg Wallace and John Torode.(n)

programme.title: Inside Culture with Mary Beard
programme.desc: In a special programme to end this series, Mary is in conversation with British writer Jed Mercurio. He's the mastermind behind hit show Line of Duty, returning for a new series in the spring, and has a rich back catalogue of attention-grabbing TV drama including Bodyguard, Cardiac Arrest and Bodies. How much does his early medical and military training inform his writing? And how much drama does it take to make real events into unmissable television?(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Martin Roberts look around properties in Blackpool, Derby and the West Midlands town of Bilston, before hearing how they have been redeveloped.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Glasgow friends Simon and Carolyn are the chief cooks in both their households. They know each other's strengths and weaknesses well and are keen to see whether that will help or hinder them in Rylan Clark-Neal's fast-and-furious kitchen contest. They are joined in the Green Kitchen by queen of spice Romy Gill, while Anna Haugh brings a modern British and Irish twist to the Red Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: DIY SOS: The Big Build Nick Knowles and the team head to Barnstaple in Devon to help Jan and Lucy, whose daily four-hour round trips to hospital for life-saving dialysis treatment for two of their daughters is taking a heavy toll on family life. Along with designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen and hundreds of local volunteers, Nick and the crew extend their house to create a home dialysis centre, enabling the girls to be treated where they live and letting the whole family settle into a healthier and happier routine.(n)

programme.title: Bitesize Daily for Secondary
programme.desc: Creativity Week - Day 5 Ben Cajee and Katie Thistleton present Creativity Week, with Pixie Lott in the Big Song.(n)

programme.title: An Inspector Calls
programme.desc: Adaptation of JB Priestley's stage play. In 1912, a detective arrives in a town where a young woman has committed suicide. Interrupting a wealthy family in the midst of a lavish party, he unravels the events that led to the woman's death - an investigation with devastating repercussions as secrets are exposed and each member of the family realises they have all unwittingly played a part. Also starring Miranda Richardson and Ken Stott.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Dish of the Day
programme.desc: Try Something Different The food writer turns the contents of his weekly shop into another seven dishes, demonstrating how, by experimenting, it is possible to create foods to suit different moods. Dishes include duck and citrus salad, hot yoghurt steak and chocolate beetroot cake.(n)

programme.title: Best House in Town
programme.desc: St Albans: Wildcard Three wildcard properties enter the contest in St Albans - a converted farmyard barn with a modern twist, a zero-carbon self-build and a 1950s Scandinavian-style bungalow.(n)

programme.title: Best House in Town
programme.desc: St Albans: Final The judges return to St Albans, Hertfordshire, to give the winning homes from each category a second look, getting a fresh insight into the houses before deciding which one they like the best. Narrated by Marcus Garvey.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Edinburgh 19 Adam Partridge and Caroline Hawley inspect interesting antiques brought in by the public at Hopetoun House near Edinburgh, and presenter Paul Martin discovers more about the property by talking to those who live and work there.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Dane Baptiste, Richard Herring, June Sarpong and Kate Williams go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, as a House of Champions winner is crowned.(n)

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Kerie's Hut & Pigsties Simon Parfett and the team travel to Hampshire to meet Kerie and Dave, to transform an abandoned shepherd's hut and pigsty into a unique B&B.(n)

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: 19/03/2021 Jermaine Jenas and the team take an offbeat look at the Premier League, also discussing skills, celebrities, fashion, music and culture.(n)

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Mountain Rescue - Our Lives Documentary following the work of the Cairngorm Mountain Rescue Team, with leader Willie Anderson and his 50-strong crew of volunteers saving lives in the region. Covering 2,000 sq miles of one Britain's wildest landscapes, they battle blizzards, avalanches and 100mph winds as they respond to emergencies.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Istanbul
programme.desc: Journalist Adrian Chiles, former politician Edwina Currie, Olympian Fatima Whitbread, broadcaster Mim Shaikh, TV presenter Amar Latif, comedian Dom Joly and actress Pauline McLynn set out to cover sections of the Sultans Trail - a modern-day 2,200km pilgrimage across Eastern Europe that starts in Vienna and ends in Istanbul. Each has varying religions, with Dom and Pauline confirmed atheists. Starting in Serbia's capital Belgrade, they stay in basic hostels and sleep in shared dorms, acting as simple pilgrims traversing the ancient military route by rail and foot.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables. Plus, Carol Klein shares the highlights of the plants that shine out in winter at Bressingham Gardens in Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Later - with Jools Holland for Comic Relief The presenter chats to actor, comedian and music lover Lenny Henry, who chooses and discusses his favourite performances from the Later archive. Plus, two artists make their debut on the show. First up is Enny, a rapper and singer from Thamesmead in south east London. And Leeds-London collective Nubiyan Twist give a unique performance of their latest single, If I Know.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 19/03/2021 The day's important national and international news stories, with Faisal Islam.(n)

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: The Son Also Rises When Baltar's representatives experience an assassination attempt Admiral Adama asks Lee to offer them protection, who attempts to play an active role in defending the prisoner during his assignment.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Cashing in on Covid - Panorama As the government faces mounting criticism that well-connected people made millions out of Britain's PPE crisis, Panorama investigates who won out. More than £12billion was spent in the first six months of the pandemic on contracts to provide personal protective equipment. Reporter Richard Bilton meets one man who made £40million on a deal, and speaks to others who felt ignored in favour of less experienced suppliers. As the government refuses to reveal the full details of all its so-called VIP deals, the programme reveals the high-profile connections to one lucrative contract.(n)

programme.title: Stonehenge: The Lost Circle Revealed
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge research, a dedicated team of archaeologists has compiled the evidence to fill in a 400-year gap in man's knowledge of the bluestones of Stonehenge. By combining innovative 3D scanning techniques, traditional field archaeology and novel laboratory analysis, the team has discovered where the stones were quarried and where they first stood. Professor Alice Roberts shows how the team made its discoveries and joins Professor Mike Parker Pearson to piece together the final parts of the puzzle, solving one of the toughest challenges ever faced by archaeologists.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Invading Armies Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood check out some mind-boggling armies from the natural world, including some sleepy suburbs invaded by 10 million bugs.(n)

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes Two Sherlock fans, sisters Mille and Leila, plan a wedding mystery, featuring bangs, crashes and exploding balloons as their parents try to solve 'the case of the missing rings'.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Scottish Castle Den Two brothers want a den that looks like a Scottish castle.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Comic Relief with Malory Towers Viewers do something to Share a Smile all over the UK.(n)

programme.title: America's Cup
programme.desc: Sailing: America's Cup Highlights Action from the latest round of the 36th America's Cup, as Emirates Team New Zealand and Luna Rossa Challenge compete for the famous trophy.(n)

programme.title: Richard Hammond's Invisible Worlds
programme.desc: Speed Limits Richard examines some of the hidden wonders that lie beyond the limits of the naked eye. In the first programme, he explores the world of hidden detail during the time it takes the human eye to blink, and uses high-speed cameras to glimpse one of nature's most fleeting spectacles.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in physical and mental challenges designed to test their ability to communicate, with trainers and canine scientists on hand to help them develop the relationship between human and animal. In the first episode, half the contestants must lead their dogs through a series of gates using verbal and physical signals, while the others must collect tennis balls in fast-flowing water. The final challenge sees the owners and dogs compete in a tethered biking challenge, to decide who has triumphed in the first stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Northern Europe Monty Don journeys to northern Europe, where an abundance of botanical hot spots reveals a culture obsessed with creating gardens. He discovers the floral splendour of Britain's Sissinghurst Castle and the much painted garden of impressionist Monet at Giverny, before witnessing the midnight sun in Norway as he discovers how plants behave 200 miles above the Arctic Circle.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Nadiya
programme.desc: Part two of two. After spending a week with her family in Sylhet, Nadiya Hussain cooks her way around Bangladesh and learns more about the country, its people and its food. In the capital city Dhaka, the Great British Bake Off winner spends time with a charity that delivers school meals to deprived children, before learning about an ancient fishing method in a small Hindu village on the banks of the Padma. As her journey continues, she meets and learns from food entrepreneurs and experiences a side of modern Bangladesh she never knew existed.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers
programme.desc: Bread Dave Myers and Simon King travel the UK in search of quality baked British staples - pies, pastries and cakes. They begin by looking at bread and suggesting inexpensive ideas for home baking. Among the recipes they demonstrate are a classic brown loaf, a brown-ale and cheese bread to serve with onion soup, and naan to accompany a curry prepared on the shores of Derbyshire's Derwent reservoir.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Exeter 60 Paul Martin, Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey head to Dartmoor, where items of interest include a platinum disc awarded for Coldplay's 2005 album X&Y, which is signed by the band's members. Plus, an expert in America talks about a walking stick that is associated with General Tom Thumb.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Mississippi: Earth's Great Rivers A journey along the American river, whose fingers stretch into nearly half of the USA, collecting water from 31 states. The documentary follows the Mississippi through varied landscapes from its source to its mouth, starting in the towering Rocky Mountains of Wyoming and Montana, where billions of tons of water, ultimately destined to flow south are trapped as ice and snow.(n)

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. This time, triplets Peter, David and Phillip, who were adopted as young boys, have their DNA analysed by Professor Turi King as they attempt to explore their birth father's heritage. Meanwhile, a woman who was conceived from a sperm donor longs to learn about the other half of her ancestry, and find out if she has any half donor siblings.(n)

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr As semi-final week kicks off, the four remaining designers are challenged to transform two restaurants in Hebden Bridge. Judge Michelle Ogundehin reveals that the competitors will be working in pairs, with each designer responsible for a single floor in the restaurant. Who will make it to the final?(n)

programme.title: The 80s with Dominic Sandbrook
programme.desc: Under Pressure The historian continues his personal review of the 1980s, considering how by the middle of the decade, Britain was wrestling with two contradictory impulses - the rise of a strong nationalist sentiment and the emergence of an increasingly globalised world. Along the way Sandbrook examines everything from the invasion of the Falkland Islands to the invasion of the home computer. He examines the moral panic surrounding video nasties, looks at the Americanisation of UK culture and the picket-line skirmishes playing nightly on TV, as well as the Aids epidemic and the threat of the IRA.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1985 1985 sees the 'Big Four' of 80's Pop - Spandau, Wham, Culture Club and the Durans - have a relatively quiet year which ushers in a new generation of pop talent. The show becomes a barometer for the state of the nation as the ambitious King and A-ha, propelled by the most expensive video of the year for Take On Me, compete for attention with passionate politicos Billy Bragg and The Style Council who, fired up by the ongoing miners' strike and continuing threat of nuclear war, give the studio audience their all with Between The Wars and Walls Come Tumbling Down. 1985 also sees electro dance hit the mainstream as Dead or Alive top the charts with You Spin Me Round, the first number one for producers Stock, Aitken and Waterman, and Paul Hardcastle holds the top slot for five weeks with 19, a spoken word single made with new sampling technology and released on the 10th anniversary of the end of the Vietnam war. Meanwhile, movie tie-ins and record companies eyeing a 'housewives' market see a.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Random Sandi Toksvig asks a completely random selection of questions this week, with Bill Bailey, Daliso Chaponda, Sally Phillips and Alan Davies trying to come up with interesting answers - while avoiding the most obvious ones.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Croston Chris Bavin meets the local Bloom group in Croston, Lancashire, who are determined to win a gold award despite coping with the aftermath of a devastating flood. With only six weeks until judging day, they have come up an ambitious grand plan to impress the judges, but rallying a community that has been through a difficult time is a huge ask.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables. Plus, Carol Klein shares the highlights of the plants that shine out in winter at Bressingham Gardens in Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: Glorious Gardens from Above
programme.desc: Hampshire Horticulturist Christine Walkden explores Hampshire by hot-air balloon, beginning at Mottisfont Abbey in Romsey, where she meets a gardening veteran who is preparing to hand over his duties to a young protegee. She visits the Sir Harold Hillier Gardens, and also climbs into a pair of waders for a go at an unusual kind of weeding.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Lambing Special Ellie Harrison joins Adam Henson and his team for 48 hours of hectic lambing. She may be the rookie in Adam's lambing shed, but Ellie quickly gets to grips with multiple births, touch-and-go adoptions, and the emotions of the life-or-death decisions faced every day during this busiest of spring seasons on the farm. Tom Heap is on the case to find out why mountains of wool, historically the nation's most valuable sheep product, are now piling up in warehouses across the country.(n)

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast Derek Brockway goes on another walk around Wales, this time travelling from Porth Swtan to Cemlyn Bay, where he visits a house restored by locals and tries his hand at whittling.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: 21/03/2021 Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at some of his favourite recipes and best moments from the programme.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: Mumbai and Pondicherry The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.(n)

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: In light of Britain's baking obsession, actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents a selection of recipes from television chefs, including James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Songs of Praise: The Rev Kate Bottley's Favourite Moments Music and worship from around the country.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Joy of the Coast 2 Nicholas Crane and the team discover the pure pleasure of seaside leisure, seeking out the ideal locations to enjoy their personal passions and experience the joy of the coast.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as people are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction.(n)

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: New entrant crofting couple Lynn and Sandra send their first pigs to slaughter. Raymond's best bull Major is injured in a brawl. The Rodgers hopes of Balmoral show hang on a clear TB test and buffalo farmer Stevie goes shopping in Holland.(n)

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The explorer travels from Texas to southern Mexico, meeting a woman who risks her life to take supplies to migrants stranded on the Mexican side of the border in Reynosa, one of the country's most violent cities, which is dominated by a powerful criminal organisation. He also ventures into the rainforest to explore the Maya city of Yaxchilan, and meets the modern-day descendants of this civilisation, who are increasingly marginalised and treated as second-class citizens.(n)

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Con Artists The naturalist looks at deception, theft and cheating in the natural world, revealing which species are the leading fraudsters and how they fool others into getting what they want. Chris shows how sea otters kidnap pups and hold them to ransom for food, while white-winged choughs pressgang youngsters from another family into their own so they get extra help to feed their chicks.(n)

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Into Amazonia The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower.(n)

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: Christmas - The Sahara The comedian explores the Sahara desert, where temperatures rise to 50 degrees celsius. Guided by Bobo, a local of Berber descent who was born and grew up in the desert, Romesh Ranganathan discovers a place that is vast and inhospitable, impossibly bleak and beautiful.(n)

programme.title: Heroes
programme.desc: Hysterical Blindness Samuel prepares for the arrival of a new addition to his family, turning a deaf ear to Lydia's warnings of the possible consequences. Peter tries to connect with Emma, even though she clearly wants nothing to do with him, and a different side of Sylar emerges as he desperately tries to remember the person he used to be.(n)

programme.title: Heroes
programme.desc: Tabula Rasa Sylar sets out to discover his true identity, assisted and encouraged by Samuel. Meanwhile, Peter tries to locate someone capable of saving Hiro - with a little help from Noah, who manages to track down a boy with healing powers but finds him reluctant to help.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing questions from a virtual audience around the country.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sahira tells Hanssen that he may not have been Reyhan's only victim, leading the great surgeon to become distracted while operating on her father. Chloe realises Ange is missing and grows increasingly suspicious that Cameron has something to do with her disappearance. Louis gets into an altercation with a former friend who has turned up seeking revenge.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Shrewsbury 14 Experts Thomas Forrester and Kate Bliss offer advice as contestants head out into the pouring rain in Shrewsbury to secure items of potential profit under the gavel, where auctioneer Philip Serrell awaits. Love is in the air for presenter Christina Trevanion as she explains how to flirt using a fan.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Married couple Marcus and Paul are paired with chefs Ellis Barrie and Anna Haugh in the fast-and-furious cookery contest. Paul does most of the cooking in their home and he's keen for Marcus to get more involved. The winner will be decided in a hectic 10-Minute Challenge where the chefs must cook against the clock to produce show stopping dishes under pressure. Rylan Clark-Neal hosts.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Kenilworth Castle 1 Fiona Bruce presents the show from Kenilworth Castle, near Coventry. Intriguing treasures brought in for valuation include a miniature safe, one of the world's first interactive golf games, and a trilby belonging to an 1980s pop star. Fiona also delves into the story of a car industry entrepreneur who saved the estate from ruin.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, presented by David Cornock.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: 22/03/2021 The latest stories from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Bitesize Daily for Secondary
programme.desc: Motivational Monday Motivational Monday, with Gethin Jones.(n)

programme.title: Earth: The Power of the Planet
programme.desc: Volcano Dr Iain Stewart investigates the powerful natural forces that shaped the planet over billions of years. Starting with volcanos, he abseils to the edge of an Ethiopian lava lake and explores the underwater caverns believed to have been created by the meteor that wiped out the dinosaurs. The presenter also explains the positive role played by the greenhouse effect many millennia ago in ending the last ice age.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: James Braxton v Kate Bliss - Showdown Experts James Braxton and Kate Bliss compete over four very different locations to find the best antiques to turn a profit on. It's a tense finale with both investing a lot of money in their final lots as they approach the showdown auction.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The Great Melt David Attenborough describes the annual melting of more than three million square miles of Arctic sea ice, which can be perilous for indigenous species. He also assesses fears that the region could be ice-free throughout the summer months in 50 years' time, and speculates on the results for native polar bears, whales and guillemot chicks.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Elephants Chris Packham explores the anatomy and physiology of the largest land animal on the planet, the elephant. Its size seems ill-suited to surviving the most arid regions of Africa, but its inner workings allow it to defy the extreme heat of the desert, and find food and water in seemingly barren landscapes, while its extraordinary memory enables it to repel predators. Here, Chris reveals how hairs on the skin help to keep the elephant cool, and how sensors in its feet may be able to guide it toward rain.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Morecambe 13 In Morecambe, Lancashire, antiques experts Charles Hanson and Catherine Southon find treasures to take to auction including a vintage Rolex watch. Plus, presenter Paul Martin discovers the rags to riches story of the town's most famous son - Eric Morecambe.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Gary Delaney, Rose Matafeo, Valerie Singleton and Rav Wilding go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in trivia-based games, with a winner declared each Friday.(n)

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Following Jez and Ieuan, two young men from Llanelli who had a dream to change their lives and become pizza-makers extraordinaire. The pair decided to buy an old Italian van, put an oven in the back and set off on an adventure to enter the World Pizza Championships in Parma. In the first episode, the pair get some last minute tips from their favourite Cardiff pizzeria, host their own special send-off before packing up their van, Smokey Pete, and hitting the road.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: Naughty But Nice The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge continues to celebrate the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to easy-to-make crowd-pleasers and family classics. In this edition, Mary focuses on food that exemplifies indulgence, demonstrating mouth-watering dishes that give the mundane a lift with lashings of naughtiness. Treats are in store as she investigates the history of the British pie and reveals the secrets to making an easy sticky toffee pudding.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Stephen Sondheim musicals, dog breeds, Alan Partridge, and the Charles Paris novels by Simon Brett, before they are tested on their general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Third-Place Play-Off Victoria Coren Mitchell presents as the losing semi-finalists battle it out for third place, with the two teams competing to guess the connections between things that seem utterly random at first glance. One of the sequence asks what links Heisenbug, Boggart, Weeping angel, and Schroedinger's cat.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The first of the semi-finals sees two teams of four students battling it out to make it to the climax of the competition and the chance to take home the trophy. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: MGM Cotai, Macau Giles Coren and Monica Galetti visit a hi-tech hotel in the self-governing Chinese gambling capital of Macau. Monica gets special access to a secret set of VIP suites dubbed The Mansion, where it takes more than just money to book an exclusive room. Giles visits a special theatre that sends its audience flying through the air, and helps to arrange the flowers for the Chinese New Year celebrations.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Black Mirror creator Charlie Brooker hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from December 2019, with broadcaster Emma Barnett and comedian Phil Wang joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 22/03/2021 Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: A Week in the Wild
programme.desc: Ex-politician Stanley Johnson, broadcaster and model Melanie Sykes, and comedian Henning Wehn tackle an iconic long-distance hike in Mexico's Copper Canyon, where they learn about the country's culture, people and environment.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Lambing Special Ellie Harrison joins Adam Henson and his team for 48 hours of hectic lambing. She may be the rookie in Adam's lambing shed, but Ellie quickly gets to grips with multiple births, touch-and-go adoptions, and the emotions of the life-or-death decisions faced every day during this busiest of spring seasons on the farm. Tom Heap is on the case to find out why mountains of wool, historically the nation's most valuable sheep product, are now piling up in warehouses across the country.(n)

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Ashley John-Baptiste pick up the case of a man who lost thousands of pounds and his home after falling in love with a woman claiming to be a gold trader. The story takes a bizarre twist as the mysterious woman known as Maryanne starts making financial demands of them too.(n)

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Fiona's Narrowboat Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team are in Bradford-on-Avon to help single mother Fiona transform her 110-year-old narrowboat into a thriving short-rental business. Faced with an almost empty shell, it looks like being a big job. Before long, Zoe is painting and renovating the interior, while Simon and Ian maximise the space with foldout beds and a copper-fronted bath in the stern.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Chefs Ellis Barrie and Jeremy Pang prepare meals against the clock, using ingredients brought in by two friends who teach young people life skills. Rylan Clark-Neal hosts.(n)

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Mandy and Chris adore their Victorian home in Manchester, but they cannot unlock the potential of their garden. Overlooked on all sides, the couple feel exposed whenever they spend time in it. Providing inspiration for the area are designers Helen Elks-Smith and Pip Probert. Meanwhile, Joel Bird meets Ben and Elaine, a Wiltshire couple who have an unusual outdoor space. Angela Scanlon hosts.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: 23/03/2021 The latest stories from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Bitesize Daily for Secondary
programme.desc: Useful Study Tips Gethin Jones presents study tips with the help of YouTuber Jack Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Earth: The Power of the Planet
programme.desc: Atmosphere Dr Iain Stewart examines Earth's unique atmosphere, revealing how it was initially made up of noxious volcanic gases until the emergence of life forms gave the planet oxygen. He also visits Argentina to explain how the atmosphere affects the weather - and almost loses his eyebrows during an experiment designed to demonstrate how methane is escaping through the permafrost in Siberia.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: David Harper v Philip Serrell - Foreign Antiques Market David Harper takes on Philip Serrell at an antiques market in Maastricht in the Netherlands, where Philip struggles to find a bargain and David discovers a Victorian museum piece.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The Great Salmon Run David Attenborough describes the annual return of half a billion Pacific salmon to the rivers of Canada and Alaska where they were born - and where bears hungrily await them. Every year, the fish travel up to 20,000 miles to spawn and die, swimming upstream and leaping over giant waterfalls as part of an extraordinary natural event that helps sustain the entire ecosystem.(n)

programme.title: The Wonder of Animals
programme.desc: Foxes Chris Packham learns how foxes have been able to adapt and thrive in a world with an ever-increasing human population. New research reveals how the animals' split pupils enable them to hunt in the bright desert day, and the presenter discusses a theory that the creatures use the Earth's magnetic field to determine the location of their prey.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Packwood House 18 A collection of previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting St Albans Cathedral, Wolverhampton Art Gallery, and Packwood House in Warwickshire.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Gary Delaney, Rose Matafeo, Valerie Singleton and Rav Wilding go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.(n)

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Pizza chefs Jez and Ieuz continue their adventure across Europe in San Sebastian, where they tour the Spanish city's best tabernas sampling pintxos, before heading to Bordeaux.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers: Route 66
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King embark on a 2,000-mile journey along the famous American road, taking them through eight different states, each with their own history, flavours and people. They begin by learning about Chicago's meatpacking industry, before moving on to small-town American, where they spend time with the Amish community, cooking together and learning about their different way of life. Their first leg ends in St Louis, where they try 'concrete custard' - a treat so rich and thick it has to be served upside down.(n)

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr Having survived seven tough design challenges, the two finalists go head-to-head to battle it out for the ultimate prize as they are challenged to transform luxury holiday villas in Cornwall, before Judge Michelle Ogundehin decides who will be this year's winner. Presented by Alan Carr.(n)

programme.title: The Detectives: Fighting Organised Crime
programme.desc: Police are called after a wealthy man suspected to be linked to drug crime was taken from his home in central Manchester by an armed gang. After locating the address where the victim was held and tortured, forensic evidence leads officers to name suspects, but while the hunt is on to find these dangerous criminals, another horrific kidnap happens.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Tom Allen is the host for the first in a new run of stand-up showcases, performed in front of a live audience at London's world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. Each show features sets from two of the country's most acclaimed up-and-coming comedians, and this week it is Rosie Jones and Kae Kurd taking to the stage. Performers set to appear in this series include Sindhu Vee, Alex Edelman, Lou Sanders, Darren Harriott, Jessica Fostekew, Stephen Bailey, Desiree Burch, Paul McCaffrey, Jonny Pelham, Ardal O'Hanlon, Sara Barron, Mawaan Rizwan, Guz Khan, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Rhys James, Sarah Pascoe, Chris McCausland and Flo & Joan.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 23/03/2021 Analysis of the day's events, with Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Con Artists The naturalist looks at deception, theft and cheating in the natural world, revealing which species are the leading fraudsters and how they fool others into getting what they want. Chris shows how sea otters kidnap pups and hold them to ransom for food, while white-winged choughs pressgang youngsters from another family into their own so they get extra help to feed their chicks.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which adventurer Paul Rose explores the 79 miles of the Yorkshire Wolds Way, one of Britain's least well-known national walking trails. The trail starts at the Humber Estuary and ends at the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Filey. On the way, Paul takes in the views from the top of the Humber Bridge, learns to ride a penny farthing and searches out the spots made internationally famous by the artist David Hockney.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Ebony Sea As night settles over a rocky coast, Bob Ross produces a warm glow in the sky in a painting on black canvas.(n)

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Golden Lads and Girls James's luck takes a sudden turn for the better in his romance with Helen, but there is no respite for the unfortunate Dalby family. Tristan's capacity for causing chaos shows no sign of coming to an end.(n)

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: Coming of Age The critic examines the coming-of-age film, and explains why it is such a powerful and popular medium for exploring the tumult and transformations of adolescence. Featured movies include The 400 Blows, The Breakfast Club, Kes and Lady Bird.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Uzbekistan to Syria Dan Cruickshank's journey takes him through Uzbekistan, Iran and Syria, where he finds the local people far more welcoming to Western travellers than expected. Among the locations he visits are the Fire Temple of Azerbaijan, the Trading Domes of Uzbekistan, the Bisitun carvings at the top of a cliff face in Iran, and the ancient city of Persepolis.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Ebony Sea As night settles over a rocky coast, Bob Ross produces a warm glow in the sky in a painting on black canvas.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which adventurer Paul Rose explores the 79 miles of the Yorkshire Wolds Way, one of Britain's least well-known national walking trails. The trail starts at the Humber Estuary and ends at the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Filey. On the way, Paul takes in the views from the top of the Humber Bridge, learns to ride a penny farthing and searches out the spots made internationally famous by the artist David Hockney.(n)

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: Coming of Age The critic examines the coming-of-age film, and explains why it is such a powerful and popular medium for exploring the tumult and transformations of adolescence. Featured movies include The 400 Blows, The Breakfast Club, Kes and Lady Bird.(n)

programme.title: Folk Hibernia at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the finest in Irish folk music, featuring a compilation of performances from the BBC archives. Highlights include songs by the Clancy Brothers, the Chieftains, Christy Moore, the Pogues and Sharon Shannon.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1990
programme.desc: 18/10/1990 Mark Goodier hosts the edition first aired on October 18, with performances by artists including A-ha, Aztec Camera and Mick Jones, Innocence, Whitney Houston, Happy Mondays, Rita MacNeil, Hi Tek 3 featuring Ya Kid K, Maria McKee and Belinda Carlisle.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1990
programme.desc: 25/10/1990 Jackie Brambles hosts the edition first aired on October 25, with performances by artists including Belinda Carlisle, Public Image Ltd, the Beautiful South, Berlin, Paul McCartney, the Righteous Brothers, the Soup Dragons, Paul Simon, Roxette and Jason Donovan.(n)

programme.title: St Patrick's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of classic pop performances from the BBC archives to celebrate St Patrick's Day. This selection reflects the huge impact that music from Ireland and Northern Ireland has made across the globe, with performances from U2, Sinead O'Connor, Van Morrison, the Pogues, the Corrs, the Cranberries, Boyzone and Westlife.(n)

programme.title: Citizens of Boomtown: The Story of the Boomtown Rats
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the Irish band led by Bob Geldof, who scored hits in the late 1970s and early 80s with the likes of Rat Trap and I Don't Like Mondays, before disbanding a year after Geldof's hugely successful Live Aid event in 1985. The group reformed in 2013 and released their seventh studio album in March 2020.(n)

programme.title: The Irish Rock Story: A Tale of Two Cities
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of how rock music evolved in Ireland over 40 years. The film demonstrates how the sounds that emerged were grounded in the musical traditions of the island's two main cities, from the pioneering touring showbands of the late 1950s through to the modern day. Richard Dormer narrates an examination of how the harder sounds of Belfast merged with the more folk-centric traditions of Dublin, celebrates some of the key musicians to have emerged from the Irish scene, and reveals how they were influenced by the political, social and cultural climate of their surroundings. With contributions from U2, Sinead O'Connor and Bob Geldof.(n)

programme.title: Showbands: How Ireland Learnt to Party
programme.desc: The showband was a uniquely Irish phenomenon. It was a movement that saw thousands of young people travel up and down the country in the late '50s, '60s and early '70s to the 'Dancehalls of Romance' to be entertained by the Royal Showband, the Miami Showband and Big Tom and the Mainliners, and individuals including Dickie Rock, Joe Dolan and Brendan Bowyer. Ardal O'Hanlon looks back at the phenomenon, examining what triggered the infamous era, the people involved, and its eventual end in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: TOTP2: St Patrick's Day Special Steve Wright narrates a St Patrick's Day special, featuring archive performances by the Boomtown Rats, the Corrs, Enya, Shane MacGowan and Johnny Depp, Stiff Little Fingers, Thin Lizzy, Sinead O'Connor and U2.(n)

programme.title: St Patrick's Day at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of classic pop performances from the BBC archives to celebrate St Patrick's Day. This selection reflects the huge impact that music from Ireland and Northern Ireland has made across the globe, with performances from U2, Sinead O'Connor, Van Morrison, the Pogues, the Corrs, the Cranberries, Boyzone and Westlife.(n)

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: Summer The land is bathed in 24-hour sunlight during the short Alaskan summer, luring hummingbirds up from Mexico, exposing deserts in the Arctic and relying on parachuting firefighters to tackle forest fires in its vast wilderness. Grizzly bears fatten up on a sudden wealth of salmon, a caribou calf joins a vast herd on its great migration and a huge male moose finds unlikely ways to impress a female. Among the human population, a dedicated grower of giant vegetables takes his half-ton pumpkin to the Alaska State Fair.(n)

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: The Making of Captain Cook Paul Rose tells the story of Captain James Cook's historic 1768 voyage to find a vast southern continent. No such land mass was discovered, but the crew of the Endeavour went on to Tahiti and Australia, which Cook claimed for Britain. The ship was almost ripped apart on the Great Barrier Reef, but the captain's navigational skills eventually steered it back home to safety.(n)

programme.title: Double Agent: The Eddie Chapman Story
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre revisits the story of wartime double agent Eddie Chapman, the subject matter of his best-selling book Agent Zigzag. He reveals how, during the Second World War, Chapman was able to dupe Nazi Germany so successfully that he was awarded the Iron Cross, the country's most prestigious decoration. Includes footage from an interview the former spy gave three years before his death in 1997.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1990
programme.desc: 18/10/1990 Mark Goodier hosts the edition first aired on October 18, with performances by artists including A-ha, Aztec Camera and Mick Jones, Innocence, Whitney Houston, Happy Mondays, Rita MacNeil, Hi Tek 3 featuring Ya Kid K, Maria McKee and Belinda Carlisle.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1990
programme.desc: 25/10/1990 Jackie Brambles hosts the edition first aired on October 25, with performances by artists including Belinda Carlisle, Public Image Ltd, the Beautiful South, Berlin, Paul McCartney, the Righteous Brothers, the Soup Dragons, Paul Simon, Roxette and Jason Donovan.(n)

programme.title: Smashing Hits! The 80s Pop Map of Britain and Ireland
programme.desc: Midge Ure, lead singer of Ultravox and one of the men behind Band Aid, and Kim Appleby, who had a string of hits with her sister Mel in the Stock, Aitken & Waterman-produced band Mel and Kim, revisit the 1980s to determine why certain cities produced their own diverse tunes. In the first episode, they explore London's New Romantic movement, travel to Coventry to investigate the rise of Ska and speak to some of Sheffield's electronic music pioneers.(n)

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: The Making of Captain Cook Paul Rose tells the story of Captain James Cook's historic 1768 voyage to find a vast southern continent. No such land mass was discovered, but the crew of the Endeavour went on to Tahiti and Australia, which Cook claimed for Britain. The ship was almost ripped apart on the Great Barrier Reef, but the captain's navigational skills eventually steered it back home to safety.(n)

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: Summer The land is bathed in 24-hour sunlight during the short Alaskan summer, luring hummingbirds up from Mexico, exposing deserts in the Arctic and relying on parachuting firefighters to tackle forest fires in its vast wilderness. Grizzly bears fatten up on a sudden wealth of salmon, a caribou calf joins a vast herd on its great migration and a huge male moose finds unlikely ways to impress a female. Among the human population, a dedicated grower of giant vegetables takes his half-ton pumpkin to the Alaska State Fair.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Poem of World War One: David Jones's In Parenthesis
programme.desc: Poet and author Owen Sheers traces the inspirations behind David Jones's In Parenthesis, the celebrated First World War poem that received acclaim from the likes of TS Eliot and WH Auden. Unlike many of his contemporaries, Jones only published his magnus opus in 1937, some 19 years after the end of the Great War, but the poem reflected the the entirety of his wartime experiences. Having remains a private throughout the whole conflict, Jones was uniquely equipped to detail the realities of life on the front-lines, and he fought for longer than any other British writer. Here, Sheers reads key passages, and tracks the construction of the epic poem from pomp and order of the English parade ground to the carnage of the Somme, and the horrors of Jones's campaign in Mametz Wood in northern France. Includes contributions by Simon Armitage.(n)

programme.title: The NHS: To Provide All People
programme.desc: A film poem to mark the birth of the NHS, charting a day in the life of a present day regional hospital. Written by Owen Sheers and performed by a stellar cast of acting talent, including Michael Sheen, Eve Myles, Martin Freeman, Sian Phillips, Jonathan Pryce, Celia Imrie, Meera Syal, Susan Wokoma, Michelle Fairley, Rhashan Stone, Michelle Collins and Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Railway Nation: A Journey in Verse
programme.desc: Sabrina Mahfouz, Michael Symmons Roberts, Liz Berry, Andrew McMillan, Imtiaz Dharker and Sean O'Brien celebrate Britain's love of trains by reinventing WH Auden and Benjamin Britten's train journey across Britain. The pair made their trip almost 80 years ago, travelling from London to Edinburgh on board an overnight mail train, as part of the production of the ground-breaking 1936 documentary Night Mail. Now, the six poets make a similar trip - this time during the day - to document the voices of rail travellers from all walks of life going about their daily business.(n)

programme.title: Performance Live
programme.desc: Performance Live: Kate Tempest The first in an occasional strand broadcast over the course of the next two years that showcase innovative live theatre, dance and comedy performances devised specially for TV. Spoken-word artist Kate Tempest kicks proceedings off with a night of poetry at the Rivoli Ballroom in south London, where she performs her new tale Let Them Eat Chaos, as well as introducing appearances by Deanna Rodger, David J Pugilist and Isaiah Hull, who offer their own reflections on life in contemporary Britain.(n)

programme.title: The NHS: To Provide All People
programme.desc: A film poem to mark the birth of the NHS, charting a day in the life of a present day regional hospital. Written by Owen Sheers and performed by a stellar cast of acting talent, including Michael Sheen, Eve Myles, Martin Freeman, Sian Phillips, Jonathan Pryce, Celia Imrie, Meera Syal, Susan Wokoma, Michelle Fairley, Rhashan Stone, Michelle Collins and Tamsin Greig.(n)

Includes contributions by Simon Armitage.(n)

programme.title: Railway Nation: A Journey in Verse
programme.desc: Sabrina Mahfouz, Michael Symmons Roberts, Liz Berry, Andrew McMillan, Imtiaz Dharker and Sean O'Brien celebrate Britain's love of trains by reinventing WH Auden and Benjamin Britten's train journey across Britain. The pair made their trip almost 80 years ago, travelling from London to Edinburgh on board an overnight mail train, as part of the production of the ground-breaking 1936 documentary Night Mail. Now, the six poets make a similar trip - this time during the day - to document the voices of rail travellers from all walks of life going about their daily business.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Leyburn to Bolton Castle Artist Shanaz Gulzar seeks inspiration as she explores Wensleydale, setting out from Leyburn on a walk to Bolton Castle, where Mary, Queen of Scots was imprisoned in 1568. Along the way, Shanaz discovers evidence of an industrial past and talks to a volunteer worker on the heritage railway line, while also stopping to sketch and reflect.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Shades of Grey American artist Bob Ross demonstrates how to paints a wintry mountain scene using only grey and white tones.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Giacometti Fiona Bruce and art expert Philip Mould investigate the first work of sculpture featured on the show, an unusual piece called The Gazing Head, which may have been made by Alberto Giacometti in 1930s Paris. The quest to uncover the truth is complicated by the fact that the sculpture was once broken into several pieces by a cat.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Undercover OAP: The Mole Agent - Storyville The story of a widowed 83-year-old who went undercover in a Chilean nursing home to investigate a private detective's concerns that the residents, including her father, were being abused. Despite an initial struggle with the technology involved, the aged spy adapted to his role, only to discover that the truth about the institution was very different to what his client had expected.(n)

programme.title: Morocco to Timbuktu: An Arabian Adventure
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Alice Morrison presents the first of two programmes in which she follows the salt roads of North Africa, once the world's richest trading networks, to the fabled sandstone city of Timbuktu. Setting off from Tangier, she learns how the routes were forged by the demand for gold from the mines of sub-Saharan Africa. She then passes through the Islamic city Fes, home to the world's oldest university, catches a train to the great market town of Marrakech and treks across the Atlas Mountains, before visiting the ancient caves of salt, the commodity that gave the roads their name.(n)

programme.title: Morocco to Timbuktu: An Arabian Adventure
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Alice Morrison embarks on a camel trek over the dunes of the Sahara, 3.5 million square miles of desert, for the second and final part of her journey to Timbuktu. Along the way she visits a livestock market that centuries ago provided merchants with their camels, before reaching her final destination. Far from the legendary City of Gold, Timbuktu is a city where UN solders keep a fragile peace after an incursion by Islamic extremists in 2012. Alice relives the city's glorious past with a visit to its world famous mosques, meets the Tuaregs - desert nomads who have sought refuge in there - and celebrates at a party with her newfound friends.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Shades of Grey American artist Bob Ross demonstrates how to paints a wintry mountain scene using only grey and white tones.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Leyburn to Bolton Castle Artist Shanaz Gulzar seeks inspiration as she explores Wensleydale, setting out from Leyburn on a walk to Bolton Castle, where Mary, Queen of Scots was imprisoned in 1568. Along the way, Shanaz discovers evidence of an industrial past and talks to a volunteer worker on the heritage railway line, while also stopping to sketch and reflect.(n)

The quest to uncover the truth is complicated by the fact that the sculpture was once broken into several pieces by a cat.(n)

programme.title: Morocco to Timbuktu: An Arabian Adventure
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Alice Morrison presents the first of two programmes in which she follows the salt roads of North Africa, once the world's richest trading networks, to the fabled sandstone city of Timbuktu. Setting off from Tangier, she learns how the routes were forged by the demand for gold from the mines of sub-Saharan Africa. She then passes through the Islamic city Fes, home to the world's oldest university, catches a train to the great market town of Marrakech and treks across the Atlas Mountains, before visiting the ancient caves of salt, the commodity that gave the roads their name.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Heptonstall to Stoodley Pike Artist Shanaz Gulzar goes on a ramble that straddles the north and south sides of Calderdale, stopping along the way to sketch and read poetry. She begins in the village of Heptonstall, rambles past Hell Hole and along the canal in Hebden Bridge, before climbing to the Stoodley Pike peace monument.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Autumn Splendour American artist Bob Ross offers tips and tricks as he paints a lakeside view, surrounded by golden autumn trees.(n)

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: The Writing on the Wall Hacker's latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington.(n)

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie exposes his insecurities and much more during a disastrous speech to the British Fruit Association. But it soon transpires that it's all part of his master plan. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter and Pauline Yates.(n)

programme.title: Donald Campbell: Speed King
programme.desc: Profile of the man who set eight world speed records on water and land in the 1950s and 1960s, using archive footage and first-hand testimonies from those who knew him. Campbell was spurred on by a desire to emulate his father Malcolm - who had also been a prolific record-breaker - but his career was dogged by ill fortune and bad weather. Jim Broadbent narrates.(n)

programme.title: Gravity and Me: The Force That Shapes Our Lives
programme.desc: Jim Al-Khalili investigates the amazing science of gravity, recreating groundbreaking experiments, including the moment when Galileo first worked out how to measure it. He investigates gravitational waves, finds out from astronauts what it's like to live without gravity, sets out to find where in Britain gravity is weakest and so where we weigh the least, and helps design a smartphone app that volunteers use to demonstrate how gravity affects time and makes us age at slightly different rates.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Undercover OAP: The Mole Agent - Storyville The story of a widowed 83-year-old who went undercover in a Chilean nursing home to investigate a private detective's concerns that the residents, including her father, were being abused. Despite an initial struggle with the technology involved, the aged spy adapted to his role, only to discover that the truth about the institution was very different to what his client had expected.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: 18/03/2021 Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: ITV Racing: Cheltenham Festival Live Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the third day of the prestigious festival, including feature races the 2.30 Ryanair Steeple Chase, and 3.05 Unibet Paddy Power Stayers' Hurdle, plus races at 1.20, 1.55 and 3.40. With analysis from AP McCoy, Mick Fitzgerald and Ruby Walsh, reports by Alice Plunkett and Luke Harvey, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable chat with Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Helen, Adam, Jan and Mick pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Long-time friend Jean-Christophe Novelli pays a visit and bakes him an indulgent tarte tatin, and baked apple with caramel.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England Ireland v England . Coverage of both teams' concluding match of the championship, held at Aviva Stadium. England prevailed 24-12 when the sides met at Twickenham last year and also won 32-20 here in 2019, but they have made an unconvincing defence of their title and Ireland will fancy their chances on this occasion despite also enduring a far from flawless campaign. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward, Brian O'Driscoll and Rory Best, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Geordan Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury At 694 metres in height, Pen-y-ghent is the smallest fell on the Yorkshire Three Peaks Challenge, but the dramatic summit affords far-reaching views above the Dales, with plenty of surprises en route. The peak lies 3km east of Horton in Ribblesdale and the Pennine Way links the summit to the village. As Julia reveals, the route is around 5km in length, as the Way curves initially to the north before turning east to reach the summit.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The Chapmans Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a garden for a family with twin girls who have a serious, life-limiting condition. Three-year-olds Darcie and Evie Chapman have been diagnosed with Dravet syndrome, a very rare form of epilepsy, and parents Mark and Natalie must be on permanent watch to prevent their daughters' seizures leading to something more serious. The Chapmans' current outdoor space is unsuitable for the girls, with changes of levels, colours of plants and even the light through branches influencing their condition, so the crew follows the rules of a formal garden where straight lines, order and symmetry give an unfussy overall look.(n)

programme.desc: Oscar-winning director Kevin Macdonald's feature-length documentary tells the story of coronavirus in Britain through the experience of people immersed in its impact, both personally and professionally. programme.title: Kate Garraway: Finding Derek
programme.desc: In this intimate and deeply personal film, cameras follow Kate Garraway and her family as they cope with her husband Derek's hospitalisation with Covid-19. 12 months after he was first admitted into hospital, Derek remains seriously ill, leaving Kate and her family to adjust to a very different way of life. Throughout the programme, Kate meets other people who have been affected by coronavirus, from a community nurse still experiencing life-changing symptoms of Long-Covid, to a woman whose husband has not regained consciousness after contracting the disease.(n)

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. This time, the iconic Boeing 747 flies out of the airport for the final time, with plane spotters around the world hoping to bid it a fond farewell. Elsewhere, new cargo driver Dylan hopes his love for hypnosis can get him out of a jam.(n)

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A profile of a family making traditional haggis, revealing the dish may not have come from Scotland after all. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Dead Man's Folly The sleuth is reunited with old friend Ariadne Oliver, who has been commissioned to stage a game of murder hunt at a summer fete in the grounds of Nasse House, the recently purchased home of wealthy financier Sir George Stubbs. However, the novelist's instincts tell her she's getting involved in something much darker - and she's proved right when the girl volunteering to play the part of the victim really does turn out to be dead. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Zoe Wanamaker, Sean Pertwee, Martin Jarvis, Sam Kelly, Sinead Cusack, Rosalind Ayres and Tom Ellis.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Mrs McGinty's Dead A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

programme.desc: Deceived by Flight Season 3 Episode 3/4.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The Secret of Bay 5b A diary and a parking ticket are found at a murder scene in a multi-storey car park. It is not much to go on, but Morse soon links the clues to a crime of passion involving a jealous husband, his wife and her lover. On the personal front, the Oxford detective's feathers are ruffled by a woman he finds himself attracted to. John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Mel Martin and Amanda Hillwood star.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Lions of Causton Businessman and owner of the Causton Lions rugby team Mark Adler is mysteriously found dead in the club's cryotherapy chamber, which is normally used by the players for physiotherapy. Barnaby and Winter are called in to investigate and their list of suspects soon includes Adler's wife Samantha, former coach Guy Bevan, troubled star player Danny Wickham and physio Neville Gallagher. Neil Dudgeon stars, with Tamzin Outhwaite, Don Gilet and Michael Maloney.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Till Death Do Us Part When Barnaby is dragged along to the wedding of the son of Sarah's friend Hazel, the last thing he expects to find himself doing is investigating a murder. But when his wife discovers the body of the bride, Laurel, who has been squeezed to death by her own wedding dress corset, the detective must look more closely at his fellow guests. The victim's husband Gavin is convinced that his wife's death had everything to do with her outspoken nature on her radio show, so Winter's attention soon turns to her unique community of nocturnal listeners. Gavin's scorned ex-fiancee and local wedding dress designer Serena also comes under suspicion, and Barnaby and Winter's enquiries lead them to a local wedding fayre. Neil Dudgeon stars, with Kelly Brook, Nick Hancock and Liz Fraser.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell investigate the case of Maria Roberts, the daughter of Italian parents who had a happy adoption growing up with an English family, and now hopes to find Gilda, her birth mother. The team also meets Francesca Barnes, who is in the early stages of transitioning from male to female. She was born with the name Paul and given up for adoption as a baby. Francesca is now searching for her mother, Norma, but fears her transition may prove too much of a challenge, and lead to rejection.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress heads to the island of Shikoku hoping to gain a better understanding of Japanese Buddhism. She then takes a bullet train to another island - Kyushu - where she finds the Henn Na Hotel, the world's first robot hotel. At Nagasaki, she visits Shiroyama Elementary school, one of the only buildings to survive the atomic bomb dropped on the city in 1945. Joanna then travels to Sakurajima, one of the country's most active volcanoes, before heading to the islands of Okinawa where one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War was fought.(n)

programme.desc: Live Cricket: W Indies v Sri Lanka West Indies v Sri Lanka. Coverage of the second day of the First Test in the two-match series, taking place at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, North Sound. This is only the tenth Test Series between the two sides, with Sri Lanka winning three series compared to West Indies two victories. The hosts haven't beaten their opponents in a Test Series since 2003, when they won a two-match series 1-0.(n)
